intro: Psychotria alabatensis, commonly known as the Madagascar psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Madagascar and is characterized by its striking, dark green leaves and small, clustered white flowers. The plant typically grows as an understory shrub in humid, shaded forest environments. It produces small, elliptical berries that are yellow when mature. Psychotria alabatensis is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in tropical gardens.
